greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of 4th power of continued fraction 1/ ( 1+q/ ( 1+q^2/ ( 1+q^3/ ( 1+q^4/... )))).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
For the third power see G. E. Andrews, Simplicity and surprise in Ramanujan's "Lost" Notebook, Amer. Math. Monthly, 104 (No. 10, Dec. 1997), 918-925.
formula: a(0) = 1, a(n) = -(4/n)*Sum_{k=1..n} A109091(k)*a(n-k) for n > 0. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Apr 16 2017
xref: See A007325 for first power (which has an alternative g.f.), A055101 for square, A055102 for cube.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 14 2000
ext: More terms from Kok Seng Chua (chuaks(AT)ihpc.nus.edu.sg), Jun 20 2000
